After discussing it with [~sjones], it was due to the fact that the cloud cert/bootstrap URL was not used when bundling the image.  I have euca2ools configuration file set, which has the bootstrap URL.  I see that {{euca-bundle-image}} has the option to pass both {{\--ec2cert}} and {{\--bootstrap-url}} however its a manual process.  It would be nice if this could be pulled in 'automagically' from the euca2ools config file.

*Signs*

* Image used was a raw image:
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# file ubuntu-xenial/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64.img

image: ubuntu-xenial/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64.img
file format: raw
virtual size: 991M (1039138816 bytes)
disk size: 991M
{code}
* The same image that was bundled, uploaded and registered from the cloud's CLC worked just fine.
{code}

fields.summary: euca-bundle-image doesn't pull bootstrap URL from euca2ools config

comments.body: This is the error you would see when you use the wrong cloud certificate when bundling the image.
[~sjones], I figured that was the issue.  Does {{euca-bundle-image}} use bootstrap URL?
[~hspencer], I believe it does if the certificate is not found locally. When bundling you could pass the '--ec2cert' option to ensure the correct certificate is used for the target cloud.

[~sjones], I see the issue.. yes, this worked jsut fine if I passed the boostrap URL manually or the ec2cert.  I will move this ticket, to a tools issue, and make it an improvement.  Thanks for your help with this.
Do you have --debug output from the affected command?

Looks like it grabs the wrong bootstrap URL.  Maybe its because {{\[global]}} is defined?
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# euca-bundle-image -i ubuntu-xenial/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64.img --kernel eki-73049203 --ramdisk eri-82fe8a49 --arch x86_64 --region qa-admin@asap-rocky --debug
